title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks rallied after the Fed chairman's remarks, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gaining 3.1%, 4.4% and 2.2%, respectively.

The annual rate of inflation in the eurozone fell in November for the first time since mid-2021, but the slowdown is unlikely to deter the ECB from raising interest rates further, economists said.

Years before Bankman-Fried's crypto empire collapsed, a group of employees quit in a power struggleâ€”after becoming concerned about what they say was his cavalier approach to risk, compliance and accounting.

Salesforce said co-CEO Taylor is leaving a year after he was elevated to run the software provider alongside Chairman Benioff.

A potential battle between Apple and Twitter appears to have been averted after a meeting between Musk and Cook.

DoorDash said it is laying off around 1,250 people just weeks after offering a bullish outlook for its food-delivery business.

What's News: Business & Finance
